visits.text: Historic center of Asunción: Plaza de Armas, National Pantheon of Heroes, López Palace (exteriors)
Walk along the Costanera of Asunción and views of the Paraguay River
Museo del Barro (folk art, archaeology)
Botanical Garden and Zoo of Asunción (botanical sections)
Excursion to Areguá: historic center and pottery workshops
Shores of Lake Ypacaraí (viewpoints, promenade)
Caacupé: Basilica of Our Lady of Caacupé and esplanade
San Bernardino: lakeside walk (Ypacaraí) and center
Journey Concepción → Asunción (RN5/RN3)
Cerro Lambaré: climb to the viewpoint and panorama over Asunción
Asunción: free time (urban parks, final viewpoints)

activities.text: Colorful neighborhood of Loma San Jerónimo (alleys, viewpoint)
Avenida Palma and local markets (crafts, atmosphere)
Ascent to Areguá viewpoint and walk through the flowered streets
Cordillera scenic route between Caacupé and San Bernardino
Final free visits in the center (galleries, historic facades)

visits.text: Route Encarnación → Ciudad del Este (Route 6)
Ciudad del Este: center, views of the Friendship Bridge and Paraná River
Iguazú National Park (Argentine side): walkway circuits and Garganta del Diablo
Saltos del Monday (Presidente Franco, PY): waterfalls and viewpoints
Iguaçu National Park (Brazilian side): panorama over the waterfall amphitheater
Viewpoints of Foz do Iguaçu (BR) and return to Ciudad del Este

activities.text: Lago de la República: urban park and trails
Free time on the Costanera do Rio Paraná (CDE/Presidente Franco area)

visits.text: Journey Ciudad del Este → Concepción (via Coronel Oviedo)
Concepción: Costanera on the río Paraguay and historic center
Excursion to Vallemí: limestone formations and caves (cuevas de Vallemí)
Banks of río Paraguay at Vallemí (viewpoints)
Belén: village on the banks of río Paraguay and river viewpoint
Local museum or interpretation center (depending on opening hours)

activities.text: Calle Palma of Concepción and cathedral
Return to Concepción via the northern Chaco route (eastern shore)
Walk along the riverbanks and return to Concepción

visits.text: Journey Asunción → Encarnación (RN1)
Encarnación: Costanera and urban beaches on the Paraná River
Jesuit ruins of Jesús de Tavarangüe (UNESCO)
Jesuit ruins of Santísima Trinidad del Paraná (UNESCO)
San Cosme y Damián: former Jesuit college and astronomical observatory
Viewpoints over the Paraná and San Cosme dunes (depending on access)

activities.text: Return through the rural landscapes of Itapúa
